title: Downing Street party: 'We feel like the government is laughing at us'
description: People fined for rule-breaking in lockdown share their stories and views on the No 10 lockdown party.

title: The 86-year-old runner who refuses to slow down
description: Tony Bowman, who has had two heart attacks, is aiming to run the 100m when he's 100 years old.

title: What is Sue Gray investigating?
description: Tory MPs have been urged to wait for the civil servant's report before passing judgement on Boris Johnson.

title: Quiz of the week: Why was a rat awarded a medal?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: The puzzle of America's record Covid hospital rate
description: Europe has fewer Covid patients in hospital now. Why are the US and Canada bucking the Omicron trend?

title: Boris Johnson: Ministers rally round PM as he faces calls to quit
description: Boris Johnson is under pressure to go after admitting attending a drinks party during lockdown.

title: Ashling Murphy: 50-strong team investigating Tullamore murder
description: The killing of a 23-year-old teacher in County Offaly is described as a "truly shocking crime".

title: Next cuts sick pay for unvaccinated staff forced to self-isolate
description: The retailer changes its sick pay rules as employers face soaring absences due to Omicron.

title: Jonathan Van-Tam to leave role as deputy chief medical officer
description: The professor's colourful analogies helped explain coronavirus during Downing Street news briefings.

title: Memorable moments of Van-Tam's pandemic advice
description: Watch the best bits from England's deputy chief medical officer, who's announced he's stepping down.

title: Jacob Rees-Mogg calls Scottish Tory leader a 'lightweight'
description: The government minister says Boris Johnson has been supported by more "important" MPs than Douglas Ross.

title: Andy Murray reaches Sydney Tennis Classic semi-finals as David Goffin retires injured
description: Andy Murray books a semi-final spot in Sydney as Belgian eighth seed David Goffin is forced to retire injured from their last-eight match.

title: Covid-19: France to relax travel rules from the UK
description: Vaccinated travellers will no longer need a compelling reason to enter France, or have to isolate.

title: 6m people on hospital waiting lists in England
description: Record numbers waiting for routine care - with one in 20 waiting over a year, NHS data shows.

title: Lucas Digne joins Aston Villa from Everton in £25m deal
description: French left-back Lucas Digne has joined Aston Villa from Everton a deal worth up to £25m.

title: Novak Djokovic in Australian Open draw despite visa uncertainty
description: The defending champion is in the draw even though authorities are still deciding whether to deport him.

title: Water pollution: How clean are the UK's rivers and lakes?
description: England's rivers are contaminated by a "chemical cocktail" of pollution- what's being done to tackle the issue?

title: Chris Wood: Newcastle sign New Zealand striker from Burnley for £25m
description: New Zealand striker Chris Wood becomes Newcastle's second signing of the January transfer window.

title: Rust: Armourer on Alec Baldwin film sues prop supplier over ammunition supply
description: Hannah Gutierrez-Reed seeks unspecified damages from ammunition supplier Seth Kenney and his company.

title: German court finds Syrian colonel guilty of crimes against humanity
description: The trial of Anwar Raslan was the world's first criminal case over state-led torture in Syria.

title: Christmas sales soar for Marks & Spencer and Tesco
description: M&S's food business records its best-ever festive sales while Tesco boasted of 'exceptional' demand.

title: Prince Andrew accuser unlikely to accept money settlement alone, says lawyer
description: Virginia Giuffre's lawyer says a money settlement alone would not be enough for his client.

title: Djokovic in Australian Open draw as decision looms with Raducanu set to face Stephens
description: Novak Djokovic remains in the Australian Open draw as the decision over whether the defending champion can stay in the country drags on.

title: Root wants Silverwood to remain as England coach
description: England captain Joe Root wants Chris Silverwood to remain as head coach despite the Ashes defeat in Australia this winter.

title: No English river is free from pollution - Parliament report
description: Tyres and wet wipes are soiling rivers but the biggest polluters are farms and water companies.

title: Wooden Roman figure found at Twyford during HS2 dig
description: Experts say a waterlogged ditch helped preserve the "extremely rare" item over the centuries.

title: The papers: PM's future on 'knife edge' amid 'operation save Boris'
description: The papers focus on Boris Johnson's future after he apologised for attending a drinks gathering in lockdown.

title: Berney Arms: The hamlet that has all but disappeared
description: What does the future hold for an isolated hamlet surrounded by marshland in Norfolk?

title: Playtime: Is it time we took 'play' more seriously?
description: New BBC documentary Why We Play uncovers some surprising benefits of play for the grown-ups.

title: Nigerian NFT artist Osinachi: The work created by using a word processor
description: Works by Nigerian Osinachi have made him one of Africa's leading digital and crypto-artists.

title: The alcohol-free 'off-licence' helping with Dry January
description: "You shouldn't focus on what it is that you're losing, but what you want to gain in your life."

title: 'Firefighting is not all about saving cats in trees'
description: One young firefighter describes what the day-to-day is really like. And what it takes to get hired.

title: The people using YouTube to pay for their French chateau
description: How chateaux owners are using advertising revenues from social media posts to earn a living.

title: A trade deal with India in 2022 would be a big prize
description: The UK is starting ambitious negotiations with India, but that won't solve the problems with its overall trade strategy.

title: Boris Johnson party row: Mixing work and socialising in No 10
description: Insiders tell the BBC that the lines between working and socialising became blurred.

title: Lea Campos: The Brazilian who battled prejudice & patriarchy to become a referee
description: Lea Campos battled opponents in the Brazilian establishment to achieve her dream and blaze a trail for others to follow.
